Hi Rebecca, 
Here are a few examples of what other local governments are doing to educate their citizens on public safety issues. I hope you find these examples useful as your local government moves forward in creating your programs and that you post your results on the Knowledge Network so others can benefit as well. 
-York County, VA Hosts Safety Town Program http://icma.org/en/Article/102088/York_County_VA_Hosts_Safety_Town_Program
-Canadian Fire Service Launches Regional Fire Education Coalition http://icma.org/en/Article/103954/Canadian_Fire_Service_Launches_Regional_Fire_Safety_Education_Coalition
-Educating the Public About Fire and Life Safety http://icma.org/en/Article/101804/Educating_the_Public_About_Fire_and_Life_Safety
Best, 
Robin Saywitz
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Rebecca Morris
text:
What services and/or programs does other localities offer in regards to public education?  I work for Albemarle County Fire Rescue and we are looking to expand our public education program from a reactive to proactive position.  Currently we have a free smoke detector program for our community and also offer certified child seat installations.
Thank you,
Rebecca Morris
www.acfirerescue.org
title: Fire Prevention & Life Safety: Public Education
